case_vignette: A previously healthy 20-year-old woman comes to the physician because of recurrent abdominal cramps, bloating, and diarrhea for 4 months. She describes her stools as greasy, foul-smelling, and difficult to flush. During this time she has had a 6-kg (13.2-lb) weight loss. She has no personal or family history of serious illness. Physical examination shows pallor and cheilitis. Laboratory studies show a hemoglobin concentration of 11 g/dL. Serum concentrations of electrolytes, urea nitrogen, and creatinine are within the reference range. Test of the stool for occult blood is negative and stool microscopy reveals no pathogens and no leukocytes. Analysis of a 24-hour stool sample shows 12 g of fat. The patient is asked to consume 25 g of d-xylose. Five hours later, its concentration is measured in urine at 2 g (N = > 4 g/5 h). The test is repeated after a two-week course of rifaximin, but the urinary concentration of d-xylose remains the same.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Gastrointestinal System. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having recurring abdominal cramps, bloating, and diarrhea for the past four months.
Have you noticed any specific foods that trigger your symptoms?
No, I haven't noticed that specific foods trigger my symptoms.
Do you have any blood in your stool?
No, there's no blood in my stool.
Have you experienced any recent weight loss or fever?
Yes, I've lost 6 kilograms recently, but I haven't had a fever.
Do you have a family history of gastrointestinal diseases, such as inflammatory bowel disease or celiac disease?
No, I don't have a family history of serious illness.
Have you taken any medications or antibiotics in the months leading up to the start of your symptoms?
I haven't mentioned taking any medications or antibiotics before my symptoms started.
Have you been under increased stress or experienced any major life changes recently?
I haven't mentioned any stress or major life changes recently.
Are your symptoms continuous or do they come and go?
My symptoms have been recurrent, so they come and go.
Have you had any recent travel history that coincided with the start of your symptoms?
I haven't mentioned any recent travel.
Do you experience any improvement in symptoms after a bowel movement?
I haven't mentioned any improvement in symptoms after a bowel movement.
Do you have any other medical conditions or are you currently on any other forms of medication?
No, I'm previously healthy and haven't mentioned any other medical conditions or medications.
Final Diagnosis: Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS)
